newsitem.title: USA: Jet fuel steady in USG, dealers seek price bottom.
newsitem.headline: Jet fuel steady in USG, dealers seek price bottom.

text.p: Jet fuel differentials were steady in the U.S. Gulf Friday amid a quiet market as many dealers stepped to the sidelines seeking a bottom to falling outright prices.
NYMEX July heating oil settled off 1.80 cents at $51.52 a barrel, down 4.45 cents a gallon for the week.
"I think everybody is waiting for a bottom in prices and wanting to get the best price," said a U.S. Gulf dealer, noting thin trading activity.
Prompt airline quality 54 grade jet fuel traded at 0.60 cent under NYMEX July heating oil, in line with the bid/ask talk of 0.75 and 0.50 under respectively Thursday.

In the New York Harbor, 54 grade traded 1.40 cents over July heat, in line with Thursday's talk. Low sulphur jet fuel was talked in the Harbor at a 0.75 cent regrade to 54 grade, slightly firmer than Thursday's bid/ask spread.
